transformed_texts:
I think the Catholic Church should change.

Many people are leaving the Catholic Church because they do not accept many things. This is why they are losing followers. The Catholic Church has strong views, like against gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. These views are old-fashioned.

People do not agree with them on these subjects. They feel the Catholic Church has the wrong views. For example, if they believe in abortion but the Church says it is wrong, they will not feel comfortable following them.

I think the Church should change its views. For example, they should allow female priests. I do not see why priests cannot be married. They say priests are married to God, but everyone else has family life too.

I do not know if these changes would prevent people from leaving. They might still leave if they do not agree with other views. But it would be a start.

I am not against gay marriage. I think people should not be responsible for their sexual orientation. I believe it is not a conscious choice. It is not wrong to say a man and a woman can marry, but two people of the same sex cannot. I do not think the federal government should be involved. It is not a legal or moral issue. The government should not interfere in people's lives. Gay people should not be punished for who they are. It is no one's choice.

I think gay marriage should be legalized.
Many people say gay couples threaten the heterosexual family.
But, they are different.
They are like two sides of the same coin.
It is not the same.
They are like civil rights.
Gay and straight couples have the same rights.
It is one of the same things.
Homosexuals ask for a marriage certificate, not for a church wedding.
If the government does not involve the church, it should not be a problem.
It is like segregation.
It is separate but not equal.
Gay couples can have children and be good parents.
Children will have the same problems as children of straight couples.
I think the federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state.
The amendment should be the opposite.
President Bush has strong views about gay marriage.
He thinks it is against his religion.
But, morality is different for everyone.
The government should not make religious laws.
Many people think gay people are damaged.
But, this is not true.
The American Psychological Association says it is not true.
We should listen to scientists, not just neighbors and friends.

I work in a hospital pharmacy.
I think illegal drugs can be good for medicine.
Like, oxycodone, Vicodin, Percocet.
These are used in hospital because they help.
Even though they are illegal, they help.
It is not the same as alcohol.
Alcohol can be bad if you abuse it.
I think, if we start to use marijuana for medicine, it is good.
People think marijuana is bad because it is illegal.
But it is not as bad as other drugs, like heroine or cocaine.
We use it responsibly, it can help.

I think church has changed for twenty-first century.
It not as strict as before.
When I was young, I went church every Sunday.
I wore cute dresses, matching shoes, and a purse.
This was at a private school.
We met friends there on weekends.
But now, church is more casual.
Teenagers have a short service.
People wear casual clothes, even beach clothes.
Families come late.
Mornings, people wear jeans and khakis.
I don't know church politics.
But I think it not about marriage or female priests.

I don't think pedophilia in church could be prevented by allowing marriage or female priests.
Some men are married and still become pedophiles.
This is not about rules, it's about the person.
I think it's genetic, not about upbringing.
Genetics can't be hidden by marriage.
If they know and cover up, that's wrong.
But I don't think they always knew.
I have no other thoughts about Catholic Church.

I was fine with the idea at first. But after September 11th, I think everyone was still upset. I think the Bush administration used this as a reason to go to war in Iraq. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction and linked it to Bin Laden's attacks. But this turned out not to be true. I feel this was a lie to the American people. Even Colin Powell admits he wasn't convinced with the evidence he presented. I think this was a serious mistake. The Bush administration has not taken responsibility for this. They have ignored the constitution and acted without respect for it. I think they wanted to go to war from the start. The treasury secretary, I forget his name, mentioned this in his book. I think the younger Bush wanted revenge for his father's time in office and to get more oil. I think it's gone on too long. If we leave now, there might be a civil war and more deaths. The UN and US are thinking of having Syria and Saudi Arabia help. But this might cause more problems because of Iraq's sovereignty. The government is weak and not working well. The parliament is not effective and there is still fighting among different groups. I can't think of any polite way to say this.

I talk into the machine.

Mm, what about the Iraq War?

Um, I feel it is not a real war.

I do not know many details.

But I think we are there to build democracy and get oil.

I do not think it is fair to stay there.

If we leave, they will be angry.

We cannot build democracy in one day.

If we stay, we waste resources.

I feel bad for Bush because it looks bad.

The Vietnam War was an undeclared war, too.

It is hard to say if the war should end.

Many soldiers are there.

I want them to be safe.

But it will hurt them more if we stay.

We should leave.

The whole thing will go on for many years.

I do not think it is right to make it legal or for a state to allow it. The Constitution says that church and state are separate. Trying to change this would go against what is already written.

Most churches, including Catholics, are against it. Only some areas, like Boston, support it. However, it is not the government's place to decide what churches can and cannot make illegal.

Separation of church and state is important in our Constitution. Adding an amendment to change this would be wrong. It would go against the Constitution and restrict people, not the government.

The government should not be involved in this issue. The president's push for this amendment seems to be because of his Catholic beliefs. He is showing a preference for one religion over others.

The amendment should not be made because of personal beliefs. It will not affect the economy. Maybe it could even help society.

I have said most of what I think.

The Iraq war happened. I did not think the government was honest with people about reasons for war. They said it was about terrorism from September 11, but this was not true. The government also said it was easy to make Iraq democratic, but it is hard. Many American soldiers died. The government was not prepared for what happened after the war started. They did not plan for all possible outcomes. They also tried to make people think it would be short and successful. Many people did not want to believe this. I think the government was not honest. The war is still happening. Many American troops are still fighting. It is hard to stop the fighting. I hope it ends soon, but it probably will not. The government did not do enough to help Iraq become democratic. It is like Vietnam. The government should have learned from the past.

I support gay marriage. I have always felt this way. I think it is a personal preference, not something people can control. It is not fair to take away rights because of something like this. It is inhumane. I advocate for gay marriage.

I do not think politics or government should control this. It is not about states or the government. It is about personal and family choices. In my neighborhood, there are openly gay couples who do not get married because they are not allowed. They function like any other family. They walk their dogs like anyone else.

I think it is ridiculous for Bush to try to interpret the meaning of marriage. It is not his place to decide for everyone. Marriage should be a private, personal matter, not a public affair.

I have read and heard that being gay could be due to biological reasons, like a chemical in the brain. It is not usually because of upbringing or family. It is not about having sisters or not having a father. So, it is not sociological, but biological.

Marriage should be something that affects only the people involved. If a man and a woman want to marry, they can do it without telling anyone. But if two men or two women want to marry, it becomes a big news story. It should be a private matter, not a public one.

I do not want the government involved in this. It should be a private decision, not a national issue.

When you put something on the internet, it is public. This means everyone can see it. You cannot control what people think. If you talk about dangerous things, people will worry. It is important to think carefully before you post. The internet can be dangerous. It is not safe to talk about dangerous things. If someone reads something dangerous, they can report it. If the school receives this information, they must act quickly. They must take it seriously. They cannot ignore it. If something bad happens, they could have stopped it. But, not all information is true. Some people make jokes. They do not mean to cause harm. If a student makes a joke, the school must judge carefully. If the joke is serious, they must act. If the joke is not serious, they must not act. The school must be careful. They cannot invade privacy. They can only look at what is reported. They cannot spy on students. If a student reports dangerous information, the school must act. If a student makes a joke, the school must judge carefully. They must not spy on students. They must not make a fake account to follow students. They must not look at students' private information. They must be careful. They must not interfere with students' lives. They must let students live their lives. They must be careful.

I feel the war is not ending fast enough. It started to help democracy in Iraq, but it has lasted too long. Maybe we lost the original purpose. The war started because of George Bush's father's old problems with Saddam Hussein. If the war was to bring democracy to a country, it would be good. But now the reason is not clear. It seems we are fighting just to prove we are strong. The war has gone on for many years. Maybe it is time to stop. The Iraqi government should now protect itself. We are spending too much money on this war. It is draining our economy. We should spend the money on our own problems, like poverty and roads. It is not good to have citizens die in a war that we do not know why we are fighting. I think it is time to stop the war.

Can I ask a question about something?

I think it was stopped because someone looked online and found something.

Is that okay?

No, I don’t think that’s an invasion of privacy.

On websites like Myspace, if you post information, it can be seen by everyone.

You usually have to accept someone as a friend to see their profile.

If you don’t want people to see your profile, you can limit what you post.

But if someone finds something bad, like a problem, they can prevent it.

It’s hard to have one person looking at everyone’s profiles all day.

But it could be discrimination if they only look at bad students.

I don’t have Myspace, but I have Facebook.

I don’t like that people can see information about me.

I saw a TV show about a man who got a girl’s information easily and met her.

I don’t meet people I don’t know, but some people in my classes know me.

They can see my profile and know where I am and who my friends are.

I try to limit what I post, but I don’t want to limit it too much.

I only accept people I know, but you never know who can see what.

I heard that in high school, students were not allowed to have Myspace.

I don’t know if that’s a privacy issue, but I’m not sure how the school could tell students not to have Myspace.

I need to talk about the Iraq War.
I feel bad talking about it.
I hate to join people who say "I was against it from the beginning."
I was against it, but it's not important now.
Most people think it was a bad idea.
Seventy-five to eighty percent of the world, eighty percent of Iraqis, and seventy percent of American troops think it was a mistake.
It was already a disaster before we went there.
Now pulling out will be a disaster too.
It's hard to do anything in the Middle East.
The gap between the United States and Middle Eastern cultures is too big.
Administration thinks they can bring democracy to the Middle East.
They don't understand the local people.
Sure, Saddam Hussein was bad, but we should have considered all sides before invading.
It turned into a disaster.
I don't know what to say about it.
I don't see a reason to stay.
The administration might have hopeful ideas, but I don't agree.
I've never heard a good reason to stay.
If the administration wants to leave gradually, I wouldn't mind.
But I don't see a reason to stay now.
Eighty percent of Iraqis think we should leave. One-quarter want us to go immediately.
These are the people we're trying to help.
If they ask us to leave, we can say we listened.
We can still help later if needed.
We can't be the good guys in the Middle East now.
But it will be better than where we are now.

Yes, I think gender discrimination is still a big problem in the United States.

It is not only about women. Even men can face discrimination in some work fields and situations.

For example, in business, some people might not promote women to high positions because society has traditionally seen men in these roles.

Many people also think it is unusual for a man to stay at home and take care of children. They might look down on this because they think men should be the main money-makers in a family.

In the fashion industry, some people might not take men seriously if they are into fashion. This is because many people think only women understand fashion.

Depending on the job, gender discrimination can happen. It is difficult to change this because society has set ideas about what men and women should do.

However, things are starting to change slowly. Women are getting more job positions and people are becoming more accepting.

But if we try to change too fast, people might resist. So, it is important to promote people's good qualities and not be too pushy.

It is also important to remember that discrimination can happen between people of the same gender. For example, if someone comes from a farm and has poor grammar but is very intelligent, other people might not believe them or might not promote them.

They made it so that if they catch you with marijuana, you get a ticket. This is like a traffic ticket. It is no longer a big crime. You do not go to jail. You do not have to see a judge. The police do not need to use money to take you to court. The judge does not have to see you. The lawyer for the state does not have to work on the case. This saves money. Some cities are very poor. They decide not to do this because they do not want to make it legal. Some people think it is wrong to make it legal. They do not want people to smoke it everywhere. But in a place like Denver, where people are open to new ideas, it is okay. It saves money to spend on other things. It is important to think about because marijuana can affect people's lives. It is not good to have it everywhere. It is like a traffic ticket now. It is not a big crime. It saves money.

Yes.
Many things in the Catholic Church are traditional, like going to church every week. This is good. But we also need to change when necessary.
Many Catholics are strict about following rules. Sometimes, they do not accept people who do not follow the rules perfectly. For example, my parents could not marry in the Catholic church because my father was not Catholic.
Catholic teachings say to love others, but the church does not accept people of other religions. This is not fair.
Some Catholic practices are old and outdated. They do not change even when they should.
I think priests should be allowed to marry. This might not stop child abuse. People who abuse children do so regardless of whether they are married or not. Therefore, allowing priests to marry would not prevent child abuse.

I do not know yet what I think about this topic.
I cannot say if one side is right or wrong.
This is the most difficult issue we face now.
It is about separation of church and state.
And how to define marriage.
This is hard to discuss without hurting anyone's feelings.
So, I think all unions should be like this.
If you are married, they should see it as a civil union.
This is because marriage is a sacrament.
And people do not get special tax breaks for being baptized.
So if you are married, you should just be a civil union.
And the fact that people get married should not be about what kind of marriage it is.
Two people are together.
If all the states agree on this, they should make it a federal law.
But, making a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not good.
It is not important enough to change the constitution.
This is because many people want it, but it is not large enough to amend the constitution.
Simply put, no, I do not think this is a good idea.

I grew up in a Christian home, so my thoughts on homosexuality are complex. I have many gay friends, so I understand their perspective. I believe it should not be illegal, but I do not agree with it being a national issue. I think each state should decide this for themselves. This is because many states are democratic or republican, and their beliefs will vary. If you live in a democratic state, you should accept their decision. I think homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. I believe the president should not decide this for the whole country, as he does not live in every state. He should not decide how each state runs itself. I think some issues should be left to each state to decide. The president should not ban gay marriage. If a democratic president wants to lift the ban, it will just go back and forth. It should be up to each state to decide, as they will live with the consequences.

Myspace is public. People can see what you post. School officials can too. They have right to check, like they would at home. This is important to protect students. School officials can use internet to catch students in trouble. This is invasion of privacy. But if they use it to make school safer, it’s fine.

I think school officials can use internet to check for danger. This is like checking for drugs or guns. They should not just go on internet to find students doing bad things. They should use it to make school safer.

Everything you say on internet can be found later. This is why I worry about posting bad things. If you do something bad, it can come back and cause trouble. School officials can find bad things on internet and use it to make school safer. This is their job.

School officials should not go on internet just to catch students. They should use it to make school safer. They can check for danger, like guns or drugs. They do this to protect students. This is important for parents too. They send students to school to be safe.

School officials should not go on internet to catch students. They should use it to make school safer. This is like checking for danger. They do this to protect students. This is important for parents too. They send students to school to be safe.

War start.
First, I support. Nine-eleven affect me. I want to create damage. We go quickly. No plan. It backfire. Now, I not support. I think it not help. People there fight each other. They no care about us. We no know what to expect. War different for them. They no look to improve. They just want us leave. I think they no care about us. We go there for revenge. President Bush want to go there. People want to go. We have no choice. We need to go. We no know what to do. We no have unity. We make more damage. We no help them. They no change. We hurt ourselves. We no progress. We stay there forever. We hurt ourselves.

I think the Catholic Church should change.

Many people are leaving the Catholic Church because they do not accept many things. This is why they are losing followers. The Catholic Church has strong views, like against gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. These views are old-fashioned.

People do not agree with them on these subjects. They feel the Catholic Church has the wrong views. For example, if they believe in abortion but the Church says it is wrong, they will not feel comfortable following them.

I think the Church should change its views. For example, they should allow female priests. I do not see why priests cannot be married. They say priests are married to God, but everyone else has family life too.

I do not know if these changes would prevent people from leaving. They might still leave if they do not agree with other views. But it would be a start.

I am not against gay marriage. I think people should not be responsible for their sexual orientation. I believe it is not a conscious choice. It is not wrong to say a man and a woman can marry, but two people of the same sex cannot. I do not think the federal government should be involved. It is not a legal or moral issue. The government should not interfere in people's lives. Gay people should not be punished for who they are. It is no one's choice.

I think gay marriage should be legalized.
Many people say gay couples threaten the heterosexual family.
But, they are different.
They are like two sides of the same coin.
It is not the same.
They are like civil rights.
Gay and straight couples have the same rights.
It is one of the same things.
Homosexuals ask for a marriage certificate, not for a church wedding.
If the government does not involve the church, it should not be a problem.
It is like segregation.
It is separate but not equal.
Gay couples can have children and be good parents.
Children will have the same problems as children of straight couples.
I think the federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state.
The amendment should be the opposite.
President Bush has strong views about gay marriage.
He thinks it is against his religion.
But, morality is different for everyone.
The government should not make religious laws.
Many people think gay people are damaged.
But, this is not true.
The American Psychological Association says it is not true.
We should listen to scientists, not just neighbors and friends.

I work in a hospital pharmacy.
I think illegal drugs can be good for medicine.
Like, oxycodone, Vicodin, Percocet.
These are used in hospital because they help.
Even though they are illegal, they help.
It is not the same as alcohol.
Alcohol can be bad if you abuse it.
I think, if we start to use marijuana for medicine, it is good.
People think marijuana is bad because it is illegal.
But it is not as bad as other drugs, like heroine or cocaine.
We use it responsibly, it can help.

I think church has changed for twenty-first century.
It not as strict as before.
When I was young, I went church every Sunday.
I wore cute dresses, matching shoes, and a purse.
This was at a private school.
We met friends there on weekends.
But now, church is more casual.
Teenagers have a short service.
People wear casual clothes, even beach clothes.
Families come late.
Mornings, people wear jeans and khakis.
I don't know church politics.
But I think it not about marriage or female priests.

I don't think pedophilia in church could be prevented by allowing marriage or female priests.
Some men are married and still become pedophiles.
This is not about rules, it's about the person.
I think it's genetic, not about upbringing.
Genetics can't be hidden by marriage.
If they know and cover up, that's wrong.
But I don't think they always knew.
I have no other thoughts about Catholic Church.

I was fine with the idea at first. But after September 11th, I think everyone was still upset. I think the Bush administration used this as a reason to go to war in Iraq. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction and linked it to Bin Laden's attacks. But this turned out not to be true. I feel this was a lie to the American people. Even Colin Powell admits he wasn't convinced with the evidence he presented. I think this was a serious mistake. The Bush administration has not taken responsibility for this. They have ignored the constitution and acted without respect for it. I think they wanted to go to war from the start. The treasury secretary, I forget his name, mentioned this in his book. I think the younger Bush wanted revenge for his father's time in office and to get more oil. I think it's gone on too long. If we leave now, there might be a civil war and more deaths. The UN and US are thinking of having Syria and Saudi Arabia help. But this might cause more problems because of Iraq's sovereignty. The government is weak and not working well. The parliament is not effective and there is still fighting among different groups. I can't think of any polite way to say this.

I talk into the machine.

Mm, what about the Iraq War?

Um, I feel it is not a real war.

I do not know many details.

But I think we are there to build democracy and get oil.

I do not think it is fair to stay there.

If we leave, they will be angry.

We cannot build democracy in one day.

If we stay, we waste resources.

I feel bad for Bush because it looks bad.

The Vietnam War was an undeclared war, too.

It is hard to say if the war should end.

Many soldiers are there.

I want them to be safe.

But it will hurt them more if we stay.

We should leave.

The whole thing will go on for many years.

I do not think it is right to make it legal or for a state to allow it. The Constitution says that church and state are separate. Trying to change this would go against what is already written.

Most churches, including Catholics, are against it. Only some areas, like Boston, support it. However, it is not the government's place to decide what churches can and cannot make illegal.

Separation of church and state is important in our Constitution. Adding an amendment to change this would be wrong. It would go against the Constitution and restrict people, not the government.

The government should not be involved in this issue. The president's push for this amendment seems to be because of his Catholic beliefs. He is showing a preference for one religion over others.

The amendment should not be made because of personal beliefs. It will not affect the economy. Maybe it could even help society.

I have said most of what I think.

The Iraq war happened. I did not think the government was honest with people about reasons for war. They said it was about terrorism from September 11, but this was not true. The government also said it was easy to make Iraq democratic, but it is hard. Many American soldiers died. The government was not prepared for what happened after the war started. They did not plan for all possible outcomes. They also tried to make people think it would be short and successful. Many people did not want to believe this. I think the government was not honest. The war is still happening. Many American troops are still fighting. It is hard to stop the fighting. I hope it ends soon, but it probably will not. The government did not do enough to help Iraq become democratic. It is like Vietnam. The government should have learned from the past.

I support gay marriage. I have always felt this way. I think it is a personal preference, not something people can control. It is not fair to take away rights because of something like this. It is inhumane. I advocate for gay marriage.

I do not think politics or government should control this. It is not about states or the government. It is about personal and family choices. In my neighborhood, there are openly gay couples who do not get married because they are not allowed. They function like any other family. They walk their dogs like anyone else.

I think it is ridiculous for Bush to try to interpret the meaning of marriage. It is not his place to decide for everyone. Marriage should be a private, personal matter, not a public affair.

I have read and heard that being gay could be due to biological reasons, like a chemical in the brain. It is not usually because of upbringing or family. It is not about having sisters or not having a father. So, it is not sociological, but biological.

Marriage should be something that affects only the people involved. If a man and a woman want to marry, they can do it without telling anyone. But if two men or two women want to marry, it becomes a big news story. It should be a private matter, not a public one.

I do not want the government involved in this. It should be a private decision, not a national issue.

When you put something on the internet, it is public. This means everyone can see it. You cannot control what people think. If you talk about dangerous things, people will worry. It is important to think carefully before you post. The internet can be dangerous. It is not safe to talk about dangerous things. If someone reads something dangerous, they can report it. If the school receives this information, they must act quickly. They must take it seriously. They cannot ignore it. If something bad happens, they could have stopped it. But, not all information is true. Some people make jokes. They do not mean to cause harm. If a student makes a joke, the school must judge carefully. If the joke is serious, they must act. If the joke is not serious, they must not act. The school must be careful. They cannot invade privacy. They can only look at what is reported. They cannot spy on students. If a student reports dangerous information, the school must act. If a student makes a joke, the school must judge carefully. They must not spy on students. They must not make a fake account to follow students. They must not look at students' private information. They must be careful. They must not interfere with students' lives. They must let students live their lives. They must be careful.

I feel the war is not ending fast enough. It started to help democracy in Iraq, but it has lasted too long. Maybe we lost the original purpose. The war started because of George Bush's father's old problems with Saddam Hussein. If the war was to bring democracy to a country, it would be good. But now the reason is not clear. It seems we are fighting just to prove we are strong. The war has gone on for many years. Maybe it is time to stop. The Iraqi government should now protect itself. We are spending too much money on this war. It is draining our economy. We should spend the money on our own problems, like poverty and roads. It is not good to have citizens die in a war that we do not know why we are fighting. I think it is time to stop the war.

Can I ask a question about something?

I think it was stopped because someone looked online and found something.

Is that okay?

No, I don’t think that’s an invasion of privacy.

On websites like Myspace, if you post information, it can be seen by everyone.

You usually have to accept someone as a friend to see their profile.

If you don’t want people to see your profile, you can limit what you post.

But if someone finds something bad, like a problem, they can prevent it.

It’s hard to have one person looking at everyone’s profiles all day.

But it could be discrimination if they only look at bad students.

I don’t have Myspace, but I have Facebook.

I don’t like that people can see information about me.

I saw a TV show about a man who got a girl’s information easily and met her.

I don’t meet people I don’t know, but some people in my classes know me.

They can see my profile and know where I am and who my friends are.

I try to limit what I post, but I don’t want to limit it too much.

I only accept people I know, but you never know who can see what.

I heard that in high school, students were not allowed to have Myspace.

I don’t know if that’s a privacy issue, but I’m not sure how the school could tell students not to have Myspace.

I need to talk about the Iraq War.
I feel bad talking about it.
I hate to join people who say "I was against it from the beginning."
I was against it, but it's not important now.
Most people think it was a bad idea.
Seventy-five to eighty percent of the world, eighty percent of Iraqis, and seventy percent of American troops think it was a mistake.
It was already a disaster before we went there.
Now pulling out will be a disaster too.
It's hard to do anything in the Middle East.
The gap between the United States and Middle Eastern cultures is too big.
Administration thinks they can bring democracy to the Middle East.
They don't understand the local people.
Sure, Saddam Hussein was bad, but we should have considered all sides before invading.
It turned into a disaster.
I don't know what to say about it.
I don't see a reason to stay.
The administration might have hopeful ideas, but I don't agree.
I've never heard a good reason to stay.
If the administration wants to leave gradually, I wouldn't mind.
But I don't see a reason to stay now.
Eighty percent of Iraqis think we should leave. One-quarter want us to go immediately.
These are the people we're trying to help.
If they ask us to leave, we can say we listened.
We can still help later if needed.
We can't be the good guys in the Middle East now.
But it will be better than where we are now.

Yes, I think gender discrimination is still a big problem in the United States.

It is not only about women. Even men can face discrimination in some work fields and situations.

For example, in business, some people might not promote women to high positions because society has traditionally seen men in these roles.

Many people also think it is unusual for a man to stay at home and take care of children. They might look down on this because they think men should be the main money-makers in a family.

In the fashion industry, some people might not take men seriously if they are into fashion. This is because many people think only women understand fashion.

Depending on the job, gender discrimination can happen. It is difficult to change this because society has set ideas about what men and women should do.

However, things are starting to change slowly. Women are getting more job positions and people are becoming more accepting.

But if we try to change too fast, people might resist. So, it is important to promote people's good qualities and not be too pushy.

It is also important to remember that discrimination can happen between people of the same gender. For example, if someone comes from a farm and has poor grammar but is very intelligent, other people might not believe them or might not promote them.

They made it so that if they catch you with marijuana, you get a ticket. This is like a traffic ticket. It is no longer a big crime. You do not go to jail. You do not have to see a judge. The police do not need to use money to take you to court. The judge does not have to see you. The lawyer for the state does not have to work on the case. This saves money. Some cities are very poor. They decide not to do this because they do not want to make it legal. Some people think it is wrong to make it legal. They do not want people to smoke it everywhere. But in a place like Denver, where people are open to new ideas, it is okay. It saves money to spend on other things. It is important to think about because marijuana can affect people's lives. It is not good to have it everywhere. It is like a traffic ticket now. It is not a big crime. It saves money.

Yes.
Many things in the Catholic Church are traditional, like going to church every week. This is good. But we also need to change when necessary.
Many Catholics are strict about following rules. Sometimes, they do not accept people who do not follow the rules perfectly. For example, my parents could not marry in the Catholic church because my father was not Catholic.
Catholic teachings say to love others, but the church does not accept people of other religions. This is not fair.
Some Catholic practices are old and outdated. They do not change even when they should.
I think priests should be allowed to marry. This might not stop child abuse. People who abuse children do so regardless of whether they are married or not. Therefore, allowing priests to marry would not prevent child abuse.

I do not know yet what I think about this topic.
I cannot say if one side is right or wrong.
This is the most difficult issue we face now.
It is about separation of church and state.
And how to define marriage.
This is hard to discuss without hurting anyone's feelings.
So, I think all unions should be like this.
If you are married, they should see it as a civil union.
This is because marriage is a sacrament.
And people do not get special tax breaks for being baptized.
So if you are married, you should just be a civil union.
And the fact that people get married should not be about what kind of marriage it is.
Two people are together.
If all the states agree on this, they should make it a federal law.
But, making a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not good.
It is not important enough to change the constitution.
This is because many people want it, but it is not large enough to amend the constitution.
Simply put, no, I do not think this is a good idea.

I grew up in a Christian home, so my thoughts on homosexuality are complex. I have many gay friends, so I understand their perspective. I believe it should not be illegal, but I do not agree with it being a national issue. I think each state should decide this for themselves. This is because many states are democratic or republican, and their beliefs will vary. If you live in a democratic state, you should accept their decision. I think homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. I believe the president should not decide this for the whole country, as he does not live in every state. He should not decide how each state runs itself. I think some issues should be left to each state to decide. The president should not ban gay marriage. If a democratic president wants to lift the ban, it will just go back and forth. It should be up to each state to decide, as they will live with the consequences.

Myspace is public. People can see what you post. School officials can too. They have right to check, like they would at home. This is important to protect students. School officials can use internet to catch students in trouble. This is invasion of privacy. But if they use it to make school safer, it’s fine.

I think school officials can use internet to check for danger. This is like checking for drugs or guns. They should not just go on internet to find students doing bad things. They should use it to make school safer.

Everything you say on internet can be found later. This is why I worry about posting bad things. If you do something bad, it can come back and cause trouble. School officials can find bad things on internet and use it to make school safer. This is their job.

School officials should not go on internet just to catch students. They should use it to make school safer. They can check for danger, like guns or drugs. They do this to protect students. This is important for parents too. They send students to school to be safe.

School officials should not go on internet to catch students. They should use it to make school safer. This is like checking for danger. They do this to protect students. This is important for parents too. They send students to school to be safe.

First, I support. Nine-eleven affect me. I want to create damage. We go quickly. No plan. It backfire. Now, I not support. I think it not help. People there fight each other. They no care about us. People want to go. We have no choice. We need to go. We no know what to do. We no have unity. We make more damage. We no help them. They no change. We hurt ourselves. We no progress. transformed_texts:
I think the Catholic Church should change.

Many people are leaving the Catholic Church because they do not accept many things. This is why they are losing followers. The Catholic Church has strong views, like against gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. These views are old-fashioned.

People do not agree with them on these subjects. They feel the Catholic Church has the wrong views. For example, if they believe in abortion but the Church says it is wrong, they will not feel comfortable following them.

I think the Church should change its views. For example, they should allow female priests. I do not see why priests cannot be married. They say priests are married to God, but everyone else has family life too.

I do not know if these changes would prevent people from leaving. They might still leave if they do not agree with other views. But it would be a start.

I am not against gay marriage. I think people should not be responsible for their sexual orientation. I believe it is not a conscious choice. It is not wrong to say a man and a woman can marry, but two people of the same sex cannot. I do not think the federal government should be involved. It is not a legal or moral issue. The government should not interfere in people's lives. Gay people should not be punished for who they are. It is no one's choice.

I think gay marriage should be legalized.
Many people say gay couples threaten the heterosexual family.
But, they are different.
They are like two sides of the same coin.
It is not the same.
They are like civil rights.
Gay and straight couples have the same rights.
It is one of the same things.
Homosexuals ask for a marriage certificate, not for a church wedding.
If the government does not involve the church, it should not be a problem.
It is like segregation.
It is separate but not equal.
Gay couples can have children and be good parents.
Children will have the same problems as children of straight couples.
I think the federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state.
The amendment should be the opposite.
President Bush has strong views about gay marriage.
He thinks it is against his religion.
But, morality is different for everyone.
The government should not make religious laws.
Many people think gay people are damaged.
But, this is not true.
The American Psychological Association says it is not true.
We should listen to scientists, not just neighbors and friends.

I work in a hospital pharmacy.
I think illegal drugs can be good for medicine.
Like, oxycodone, Vicodin, Percocet.
These are used in hospital because they help.
Even though they are illegal, they help.
It is not the same as alcohol.
Alcohol can be bad if you abuse it.
I think, if we start to use marijuana for medicine, it is good.
People think marijuana is bad because it is illegal.
But it is not as bad as other drugs, like heroine or cocaine.
We use it responsibly, it can help.

I think church has changed for twenty-first century.
It not as strict as before.
When I was young, I went church every Sunday.
I wore cute dresses, matching shoes, and a purse.
This was at a private school.
We met friends there on weekends.
But now, church is more casual.
Teenagers have a short service.
People wear casual clothes, even beach clothes.
Families come late.
Mornings, people wear jeans and khakis.
I don't know church politics.
But I think it not about marriage or female priests.

I don't think pedophilia in church could be prevented by allowing marriage or female priests.
Some men are married and still become pedophiles.
This is not about rules, it's about the person.
I think it's genetic, not about upbringing.
Genetics can't be hidden by marriage.
If they know and cover up, that's wrong.
But I don't think they always knew.
I have no other thoughts about Catholic Church.

I was fine with the idea at first. But after September 11th, I think everyone was still upset. I think the Bush administration used this as a reason to go to war in Iraq. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction and linked it to Bin Laden's attacks. But this turned out not to be true. I feel this was a lie to the American people. Even Colin Powell admits he wasn't convinced with the evidence he presented. I think this was a serious mistake. The Bush administration has not taken responsibility for this. They have ignored the constitution and acted without respect for it. I think they wanted to go to war from the start. The treasury secretary, I forget his name, mentioned this in his book. I think the younger Bush wanted revenge for his father's time in office and to get more oil. I think it's gone on too long. If we leave now, there might be a civil war and more deaths. The UN and US are thinking of having Syria and Saudi Arabia help. But this might cause more problems because of Iraq's sovereignty. The government is weak and not working well. The parliament is not effective and there is still fighting among different groups. I can't think of any polite way to say this.

I talk into the machine.

Mm, what about the Iraq War?

Um, I feel it is not a real war.

I do not know many details.

But I think we are there to build democracy and get oil.

I do not think it is fair to stay there.

If we leave, they will be angry.

We cannot build democracy in one day.

If we stay, we waste resources.

I feel bad for Bush because it looks bad.

The Vietnam War was an undeclared war, too.

It is hard to say if the war should end.

Many soldiers are there.

I want them to be safe.

But it will hurt them more if we stay.

We should leave.

The whole thing will go on for many years.

I do not think it is right to make it legal or for a state to allow it. The Constitution says that church and state are separate. Trying to change this would go against what is already written.

Most churches, including Catholics, are against it. Only some areas, like Boston, support it. However, it is not the government's place to decide what churches can and cannot make illegal.

Separation of church and state is important in our Constitution. Adding an amendment to change this would be wrong. It would go against the Constitution and restrict people, not the government.

The government should not be involved in this issue. The president's push for this amendment seems to be because of his Catholic beliefs. He is showing a preference for one religion over others.

The amendment should not be made because of personal beliefs. It will not affect the economy. Maybe it could even help society.

I have said most of what I think.

The Iraq war happened. I did not think the government was honest with people about reasons for war. They said it was about terrorism from September 11, but this was not true. The government also said it was easy to make Iraq democratic, but it is hard. Many American soldiers died. The government was not prepared for what happened after the war started. They did not plan for all possible outcomes. They also tried to make people think it would be short and successful. Many people did not want to believe this. I think the government was not honest. The war is still happening. Many American troops are still fighting. It is hard to stop the fighting. I hope it ends soon, but it probably will not. The government did not do enough to help Iraq become democratic. It is like Vietnam. The government should have learned from the past.

I support gay marriage. I have always felt this way. I think it is a personal preference, not something people can control. It is not fair to take away rights because of something like this. It is inhumane. I advocate for gay marriage.

I do not think politics or government should control this. It is not about states or the government. It is about personal and family choices. In my neighborhood, there are openly gay couples who do not get married because they are not allowed. They function like any other family. They walk their dogs like anyone else.

I think it is ridiculous for Bush to try to interpret the meaning of marriage. It is not his place to decide for everyone. Marriage should be a private, personal matter, not a public affair.

I have read and heard that being gay could be due to biological reasons, like a chemical in the brain. It is not usually because of upbringing or family. It is not about having sisters or not having a father. So, it is not sociological, but biological.

Marriage should be something that affects only the people involved. If a man and a woman want to marry, they can do it without telling anyone. But if two men or two women want to marry, it becomes a big news story. It should be a private matter, not a public one.

I do not want the government involved in this. It should be a private decision, not a national issue.

When you put something on the internet, it is public. This means everyone can see it. You cannot control what people think. If you talk about dangerous things, people will worry. It is important to think carefully before you post. The internet can be dangerous. It is not safe to talk about dangerous things. If someone reads something dangerous, they can report it. If the school receives this information, they must act quickly. They must take it seriously. They cannot ignore it. If something bad happens, they could have stopped it. But, not all information is true. Some people make jokes. They do not mean to cause harm. If a student makes a joke, the school must judge carefully. If the joke is serious, they must act. If the joke is not serious, they must not act. The school must be careful. They cannot invade privacy. They can only look at what is reported. They cannot spy on students. If a student reports dangerous information, the school must act. If a student makes a joke, the school must judge carefully. They must not spy on students. They must not make a fake account to follow students. They must not look at students' private information. They must be careful. They must not interfere with students' lives. They must let students live their lives. They must be careful.

I feel the war is not ending fast enough. It started to help democracy in Iraq, but it has lasted too long. Maybe we lost the original purpose. The war started because of George Bush's father's old problems with Saddam Hussein. If the war was to bring democracy to a country, it would be good. But now the reason is not clear. It seems we are fighting just to prove we are strong. The war has gone on for many years. Maybe it is time to stop. The Iraqi government should now protect itself. We are spending too much money on this war. It is draining our economy. We should spend the money on our own problems, like poverty and roads. It is not good to have citizens die in a war that we do not know why we are fighting. I think it is time to stop the war.

Can I ask a question about something?

I think it was stopped because someone looked online and found something.

Is that okay?

No, I don’t think that’s an invasion of privacy.

On websites like Myspace, if you post information, it can be seen by everyone.

You usually have to accept someone as a friend to see their profile.

If you don’t want people to see your profile, you can limit what you post.

But if someone finds something bad, like a problem, they can prevent it.

It’s hard to have one person looking at everyone’s profiles all day.

But it could be discrimination if they only look at bad students.

I don’t have Myspace, but I have Facebook.

I don’t like that people can see information about me.

I saw a TV show about a man who got a girl’s information easily and met her.

I don’t meet people I don’t know, but some people in my classes know me.

They can see my profile and know where I am and who my friends are.

I try to limit what I post, but I don’t want to limit it too much.

I only accept people I know, but you never know who can see what.

I heard that in high school, students were not allowed to have Myspace.

I don’t know if that’s a privacy issue, but I’m not sure how the school could tell students not to have Myspace.

I need to talk about the Iraq War.
I feel bad talking about it.
I hate to join people who say "I was against it from the beginning."
I was against it, but it's not important now.
Most people think it was a bad idea.
Seventy-five to eighty percent of the world, eighty percent of Iraqis, and seventy percent of American troops think it was a mistake.
It was already a disaster before we went there.
Now pulling out will be a disaster too.
It's hard to do anything in the Middle East.
The gap between the United States and Middle Eastern cultures is too big.
Administration thinks they can bring democracy to the Middle East.
They don't understand the local people.
Sure, Saddam Hussein was bad, but we should have considered all sides before invading.
It turned into a disaster.
I don't know what to say about it.
I don't see a reason to stay.
The administration might have hopeful ideas, but I don't agree.
I've never heard a good reason to stay.
If the administration wants to leave gradually, I wouldn't mind.
But I don't see a reason to stay now.
Eighty percent of Iraqis think we should leave. One-quarter want us to go immediately.
These are the people we're trying to help.
If they ask us to leave, we can say we listened.
We can still help later if needed.
We can't be the good guys in the Middle East now.
But it will be better than where we are now.

Yes, I think gender discrimination is still a big problem in the United States.

It is not only about women. Even men can face discrimination in some work fields and situations.

For example, in business, some people might not promote women to high positions because society has traditionally seen men in these roles.

Many people also think it is unusual for a man to stay at home and take care of children. They might look down on this because they think men should be the main money-makers in a family.

In the fashion industry, some people might not take men seriously if they are into fashion. This is because many people think only women understand fashion.

Depending on the job, gender discrimination can happen. It is difficult to change this because society has set ideas about what men and women should do.

However, things are starting to change slowly. Women are getting more job positions and people are becoming more accepting.

But if we try to change too fast, people might resist. So, it is important to promote people's good qualities and not be too pushy.

It is also important to remember that discrimination can happen between people of the same gender. For example, if someone comes from a farm and has poor grammar but is very intelligent, other people might not believe them or might not promote them.

They made it so that if they catch you with marijuana, you get a ticket. This is like a traffic ticket. It is no longer a big crime. You do not go to jail. You do not have to see a judge. The police do not need to use money to take you to court. The judge does not have to see you. The lawyer for the state does not have to work on the case. This saves money. Some cities are very poor. They decide not to do this because they do not want to make it legal. Some people think it is wrong to make it legal. They do not want people to smoke it everywhere. But in a place like Denver, where people are open to new ideas, it is okay. It saves money to spend on other things. It is important to think about because marijuana can affect people's lives. It is not good to have it everywhere. It is like a traffic ticket now. It is not a big crime. It saves money.

Yes.
Many things in the Catholic Church are traditional, like going to church every week. This is good. But we also need to change when necessary.
Many Catholics are strict about following rules. Sometimes, they do not accept people who do not follow the rules perfectly. For example, my parents could not marry in the Catholic church because my father was not Catholic.
Catholic teachings say to love others, but the church does not accept people of other religions. This is not fair.
Some Catholic practices are old and outdated. They do not change even when they should.
I think priests should be allowed to marry. This might not stop child abuse. People who abuse children do so regardless of whether they are married or not. Therefore, allowing priests to marry would not prevent child abuse.

I do not know yet what I think about this topic.
I cannot say if one side is right or wrong.
This is the most difficult issue we face now.
It is about separation of church and state.
And how to define marriage.
This is hard to discuss without hurting anyone's feelings.
So, I think all unions should be like this.
If you are married, they should see it as a civil union.
This is because marriage is a sacrament.
And people do not get special tax breaks for being baptized.
So if you are married, you should just be a civil union.
And the fact that people get married should not be about what kind of marriage it is.
Two people are together.
If all the states agree on this, they should make it a federal law.
But, making a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not good.
It is not important enough to change the constitution.
This is because many people want it, but it is not large enough to amend the constitution.
Simply put, no, I do not think this is a good idea.

I grew up in a Christian home, so my thoughts on homosexuality are complex. I have many gay friends, so I understand their perspective. I believe it should not be illegal, but I do not agree with it being a national issue. I think each state should decide this for themselves. This is because many states are democratic or republican, and their beliefs will vary. If you live in a democratic state, you should accept their decision. I think homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. I believe the president should not decide this for the whole country, as he does not live in every state. He should not decide how each state runs itself. I think some issues should be left to each state to decide. The president should not ban gay marriage. If a democratic president wants to lift the ban, it will just go back and forth. It should be up to each state to decide, as they will live with the consequences.

Myspace is public. People can see what you post. School officials can too. They have right to check, like they would at home. This is important to protect students. School officials can use internet to catch students in trouble. This is invasion of privacy. But if they use it to make school safer, it’s fine.

I think school officials can use internet to check for danger. This is like checking for drugs or guns. They should not just go on internet to find students doing bad things. They should use it to make school safer.

Everything you say on internet can be found later. This is why I worry about posting bad things. If you do something bad, it can come back and cause trouble. School officials can find bad things on internet and use it to make school safer. This is their job.

School officials should not go on internet just to catch students. They should use it to make school safer. They can check for danger, like guns or drugs. They do this to protect students. This is important for parents too. They send students to school to be safe.

School officials should not go on internet to catch students. They should use it to make school safer. This is like checking for danger. They do this to protect students. This is important for parents too. They send students to school to be safe.

People want to go. We have no choice. We need to go. We no know what to do. We no have unity. We make more damage. We no help them. They no change. We hurt ourselves. We no progress. We stay there forever. We hurt ourselves.

transformed_texts: The Catholic Church must change some of their views, I think. Many people are leaving the Church because it does not accept many things. For example, it does not accept gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. These are not old-fashioned views, but they are not open to new ideas. People are leaving the Church because they do not agree with these views. The Church is against abortion, so people who support it may not feel comfortable. People who want to marry someone of the same gender may also feel this way. I do not see why the Church cannot have female priests or allow priests to be married. But I am not sure if these changes would have prevented the problems the Church is facing. The Church says priests are married to God, but other people have families and jobs too. So, priests should also have a family life, I think.

It not about security or morals. It about who they are.

transformed_texts: The Catholic Church must change some of their views, I think. Many people are leaving the Church because it does not accept many things. For example, it does not accept gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. These are not old-fashioned views, but they are not open to new ideas. People are leaving the Church because they do not agree with these views. The Church is against abortion, so people who support it may not feel comfortable. People who want to marry someone of the same gender may also feel this way. I do not see why the Church cannot have female priests or allow priests to be married. But I am not sure if these changes would have prevented the problems the Church is facing. The Church says priests are married to God, but other people have families and jobs too. So, priests should also have a family life, I think.

I not opposed to gay marriage. People born gay do not choose it. Not fair to hold them responsible for their sexual orientation. It wrong to say man and woman can marry, but two people of same sex cannot. Government should not be involved because it not a legal issue. People should not be punished for being gay. It not about security or morals. It about who they are.

I think that gay marriage should be legal.
Many people think that homosexual couples are different.
This is not true. There are many similarities.
Many people think that gay couples threaten straight families.
This is not true. Homosexual couples have the same success rates as straight couples.
They also have the same rights, like property taxes and health care.
I think that is silly.
Homosexual couples have the same needs as straight couples.
Many people worry about children in gay families.
This is not a good reason.
Children need love and support, not the sex of their parents.
I think the government should make gay marriage legal.
President Bush has strong views against gay marriage.
He thinks it is against his religion.
But morality is different for everyone.
The government cannot force its morality on everyone.
Many people do not understand why gay people are gay.
They think it is because of bad experiences in childhood.
This is not true.
The American Psychological Association says this is not true.
People should listen to research, not friends or culture.

I work at hospital pharmacy during summer.
Drugs are illegal, but this does not mean they have good effects.

But for medicine, yes.
Legal drugs like oxycotton, Vicodin, and Perocets are useful.
I believe marijuana should have good uses, too.
Alcohol and marijuana, both bad with abuse.
But marijuana not like heroine or cocaine.
Now, change bad image of marijuana.
Then people can use it responsibly.

I think our church has changed to fit the 21st century. It is not as strict now. When I was younger, I would go to church every Sunday. I would wear cute dresses, matching shoes, and a purse. But now, they have a teen mass that is just 30 minutes long. People dress more casually, especially in the summer. Sometimes, families arrive late and wear beach clothes. Even in the morning masses, people wear jeans and khakis. I don't know much about church politics, but this is the biggest change I have noticed. I don't think the church could have prevented all the pedophilia accusations if they allowed female priests or let priests marry. Some married men still have attraction to kids. I think it's genetics, not the church rules. I don't think the church could hide this issue through marriage. If they knew about it and covered it up, that's shameful. But I don't think they always knew. I have no other thoughts about the Catholic Church.

Initial, I liked the idea of the movie but the reaction to the September 11th attacks led to Iraq war. The Bush administration said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction and linked it to Osama Bin Laden. This was not true. Colin Powell also said he was not convinced by the evidence he used to support the war at the UN. I think this was a lie and a serious mistake. The Bush administration did not follow the constitution and had a hidden agenda.

I think the Iraq war was a mistake. It was not fair to the American people. The war has not ended and many people have died. The Bush administration did not tell the truth about Iraq. They wanted to expand our energy supplies and get revenge for their father's administration. The war is not going well and there is a good chance of civil war if we withdraw. People are fighting for control.

I think the war will go on for a long time.

I do not believe it is right for a state or the government to make it legal. I think the decision should be up to the churches. The Constitution states that the government should not interfere with religious beliefs.

I think many people believe this issue should be decided by the churches, not the government. Most Catholics and Christians do not support it. In Boston and other areas, there are some who do, but I do not think it is the government's place to decide what religions can and cannot do.

Separation of church and state is very important in our country. It allows for religious tolerance. Adding an amendment to change this would be wrong and go against what is already written in the Constitution. Plus, it would be one of the few amendments that restrict people, not the government.

I do not think the federal government or any government should be involved in this issue. If someone wants to push for an amendment, it should be because of their personal beliefs, not to restrict people's choices.

I believe it is up to the churches to decide about this issue, not the president or any other government official. There is no good reason to add an amendment to the Constitution to make it illegal. In fact, it might have a positive effect on society.

I am for gay marriage. I always have been.
I think it is a personal choice. It is not something people can control.
I think it is unfair to take away people's rights because of something they cannot change.
I believe in giving people the freedom to be who they are.
I do not think politics and government should decide about personal relationships.
I know people in my neighborhood who are gay. They live their lives just like everyone else.
I think it is wrong for leaders to say what marriage means.
I think marriage should be a private matter, not a public one.

I have heard that being gay might be a result of biology, not just society.
I do not believe that marriage should be different for gay people.
I think if a man and a woman want to marry, they can do it quietly.
But if two gay people want to marry, it becomes a big news story.
I think marriage should be a personal matter, not a public one.

I do not think it is fair for the government to decide about marriage.
I think people should be able to marry whoever they love.

I will not put harmful things on the internet. For example, I will not talk about blowing things up or shootings. If I say such things, people will think badly of me. The internet is public, and anyone can see what I say. If I have friends on Myspace or other social websites, they will see my messages. If I say something serious, the school will need to act. They cannot ignore it because something bad could happen. It is important to be careful about what I say on the internet. It is my responsibility to be safe and responsible. It is not their job to monitor what students do online. However, if someone brings serious information to them, they must take it seriously. I will not friend my residents on social websites because I do not want to see their personal activities. It is not my responsibility to monitor them. It is important to be careful about what I do on the internet and to be responsible for my actions.

Yes, I feel that gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States.
It affects not only women but also men in certain jobs.
For example, in business, some people have difficulty working with a woman boss.
Even when a woman has all the qualifications, some people may not consider promoting her.
Likewise, men who stay at home to raise children can face discrimination.
Society often expects men to be the primary breadwinner.
In fashion, men might be seen as less serious if they are straight.
This is because they may not understand women's fashion as well as women.
Gender discrimination exists in other industries too.
For example, in farming, people might not take someone seriously if they have poor grammar.
This can happen even if they are very intelligent.
Change happens slowly, and pushing too hard can cause people to resist.
We have made progress, but it takes time.
People are starting to accept women in higher positions and men as stay-at-home parents more.
We should promote good qualities of people who are discriminated against.
We should do this without forcing change too quickly.
We should also consider that people might discriminate against each other based on their job or background.
For example, someone from a farm might face discrimination if they have poor grammar.
Men might look down on them if they think they are not intelligent.
So, discrimination happens in many ways.

I think yes. Many things they do are very traditional, like long lasting customs. It's good to stay rooted in tradition. But it's also important to be flexible for change. Some Catholics go to church every week and are strict about how things are done. They might not accept others who don't follow the rules perfectly or who are from other religions. For example, my parents couldn't marry in the Catholic Church because my dad was an Episcopalian. This isn't very tolerant of other religions. We learned to love others, but it's hypocritical to not accept them. Some Catholic teachings say to do one thing, but the practice goes against it. It's outdated, but they still keep it. I think allowing priests to marry wouldn't stop child molestation. These things happen regardless of marriage status. So, I probably don't think that would be an issue.

I am not sure about this issue yet. I cannot say if one side is right or wrong. This topic is very difficult because it is close to the separation of church and state, and it is not easy to define marriage without hurting someone's feelings. I think all civil unions should be treated the same. If the government treats marriage as a sacrament, like baptism, then it should also consider civil unions the same way. People would not get tax breaks or be treated in a special way by the government if they were married by a church. So, I think marriage and civil unions should be treated the same. I think that two people in a union should not be questioned about the type of marriage they have.

If all states can agree on this, they should make it a federal law. But, I think a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not reasonable. It is not important enough to change the constitution. Gay marriage is not a big enough issue to change the constitution. Simply put, no.

I believe each state should decide on its own. The president is only in office for a few years. If a democratic president lifts the ban, it will just go back and forth. It is best to leave the decision to each state.

transformed_texts: The Catholic Church must change some of their views, I think. Many people are leaving the Church because it does not accept many things. For example, it does not accept gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. These are not old-fashioned views, but they are not open to new ideas. People are leaving the Church because they do not agree with these views. The Church is against abortion, so people who support it may not feel comfortable. People who want to marry someone of the same gender may also feel this way. I do not see why the Church cannot have female priests or allow priests to be married. But I am not sure if these changes would have prevented the problems the Church is facing. The Church says priests are married to God, but other people have families and jobs too. So, priests should also have a family life, I think.

I not opposed to gay marriage. People born gay do not choose it. Not fair to hold them responsible for their sexual orientation. It wrong to say man and woman can marry, but two people of same sex cannot. Government should not be involved because it not a legal issue. People should not be punished for being gay. It not about security or morals. It about who they are.

I think that gay marriage should be legal.
Many people think that homosexual couples are different.
This is not true. There are many similarities.
Many people think that gay couples threaten straight families.
This is not true. Homosexual couples have the same success rates as straight couples.
They also have the same rights, like property taxes and health care.
I think that is silly.
Homosexual couples have the same needs as straight couples.
Many people worry about children in gay families.
This is not a good reason.
Children need love and support, not the sex of their parents.
I think the government should make gay marriage legal.

He thinks it is against his religion.
But morality is different for everyone.
The government cannot force its morality on everyone.

This is not true.
The American Psychological Association says this is not true.
People should listen to research, not friends or culture.

I think our church has changed to fit the 21st century. It is not as strict now. When I was younger, I would go to church every Sunday. I would wear cute dresses, matching shoes, and a purse. But now, they have a teen mass that is just 30 minutes long. People dress more casually, especially in the summer. Sometimes, families arrive late and wear beach clothes. Even in the morning masses, people wear jeans and khakis. I don't know much about church politics, but this is the biggest change I have noticed. I don't think the church could have prevented all the pedophilia accusations if they allowed female priests or let priests marry. Some married men still have attraction to kids. I think it's genetics, not the church rules. I don't think the church could hide this issue through marriage. If they knew about it and covered it up, that's shameful. But I don't think they always knew. I have no other thoughts about the Catholic Church.
