transformed_texts:
I think the Catholic Church needs change.
They lose people because they are not accepting.
They have strict views on things like gay marriage, abortion, and birth control.
These views are old-fashioned.
If they change, they will keep more people.
People disagree with the Catholic Church.
They feel the Church has bad views on these subjects.
The Church is against abortion. If you support it, you feel bad.
The same with gay marriage. If you believe in it, you feel bad.
I think priests can be married.
I don’t know if it would help. Priests are devoted to God. They can have families too.

I am not against gay marriage. Some people are born gay. They cannot choose their sexual orientation. It is not a conscious choice. Therefore, people should not be blamed for being gay. I think it is wrong to say a man and woman can marry, but two people of the same sex cannot. The federal government should not be involved. It is not a legal or moral issue. It is not about the security of our country. The federal government should not interfere with people's lives. Gay people should not be punished for being who they are. That is just how they were born.

Gay marriage should be legal. There is no good reason to say it should not be. Many people believe that gay couples threaten the traditional family. However, this is not true. Gay couples are different from straight couples, but they are still people and deserve the same rights. They should be able to get married, have property, and make legal decisions about healthcare.

Many studies show that gay couples are as successful as straight couples. They have the same relationships and the same factors that make them happy. They are not asking to get married in a church. They just want a legal marriage certificate. If there is no church involvement, there should be no issue. It is not fair to have two different standards for gay and straight couples. It is like having separate but unequal rights.

People worry about adoption and community issues. But gay couples are as good at parenting as straight couples. They have the same skills and can be just as involved in their community. The federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state. It is not ethical to let religious beliefs influence the government. The government should not make a law that goes against the beliefs of a certain group. It is hypocritical to have laws that enforce religious standards on a whole country.

Some people think that gay people are damaged because of their childhood. However, this is not true. The American Psychological Association says that being gay is not caused by trauma or personality defects. People should listen to research and institutions that study these issues, not just their neighbors or culture. The world would be different if people listened to facts and not just popular opinion.

I work at a hospital pharmacy during summer. Some drugs are illegal, but they may have good uses. I think no for public use, yes for medicine. Like oxycotton, Vicodin, Perocets. They are controlled but useful. If we say no to marijuana because it is illegal and bad, that is not fair. We should consider its benefits responsibly. Alcohol can be bad, but so can marijuana if overused. It is not like heroine or cocaine. We should get rid of bad image of marijuana and think about using it responsibly for medicine.

I think church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict now. When I was young, I went to church every Sunday. I wore cute dresses, matching shoes, and a matching purse. Now, they have teenage masses that last only thirty minutes. People wear casual clothes, even on summer weekends. Some families arrive late. Even at morning masses, people wear jeans and khakis. I think this shows how the church has become more casual. About accusations against Catholic priests, I do not think changes like allowing female priests or priests to marry would have prevented these problems. Many married men still become pedophiles, and this is not about their marital status. It is likely genetic. Being born with such an attraction is not something the church could have stopped. If priests knew about these problems and tried to cover them up, they can be shamed. But it is not always the case that they knew. I have no other thoughts about the Catholic Church.

I was okay with starting the war in Iraq. But it felt wrong. Many people were still upset about September 11th. The Bush administration said that Iraq had weapons to attack America. This was not true. They lied to the American people. Colin Powell, who gave a big speech at the UN, now says he was not sure about the evidence. I think this is a big mistake. It is like a crime. The Bush administration did not follow the constitution. They wanted to fight a war. They had a plan to expand energy supply. I think this is not good. I think we should stop the war now. But, if we leave, Iraq might become a civil war. There are many problems with the government. The UN and USA want other countries to help. But, this could cause more problems. The political system is not good. Many groups fight for control. The government is weak.

I feel the Iraq War is not a real war because there was no official declaration by Congress. It feels like a big attempt to get back at Iraq for the 9/11 attacks. I am not interested in this topic because I do not follow the details. However, I think it is wrong to stay in Iraq because it is not beneficial for either side. It is hard to make democracy happen quickly. If we leave, Iraq may be worse off. I feel sorry for President Bush because the war makes him look bad. It is like the Vietnam War, which also was not declared. It is hard to say if the war should continue. Some people know people fighting there, and it is hard to want them to come home. However, staying in Iraq may make the situation worse. It is unclear what will happen in the future.

I am not sure it is right to make it legal or for a state to declare it legal. The constitution says churches and the state should be separate. It clearly says this.
Trying to force rules about it would be against the constitution. It would be like choosing one church's beliefs over others.
Most Catholics and Christians are against it. Only some areas like Boston support it. It is not the government's job to decide what churches can or cannot do.
The constitution has rules about religious tolerance. Making an amendment to change this would be wrong. It would only restrict people, not the government.
I do not think the federal government should be involved. The amendment is just one person's personal belief. It is not about the economy.
I think the amendment could even help society.
I think I have said all I want to say.

The war in Iraq. At first, I did not think the government told the truth about the reasons for the war. Before invading Iraq, they tried to connect the war to the attacks of September 11th. But this was not true. The government used the public's anger to start the war, which began in 2003. I did not support the war, especially for a preemptive strike. I think the war was like the Vietnam War. The government should have learned from past mistakes.

Many American soldiers died. The government removed Iraq's government. I think they were not ready for the chaos and power void that followed. The US tried to implant a democratic government, like in Vietnam. Both wars were long and hard. The government should have been more prepared.

Many people still support the US in Iraq. But it is not easy to create a new government. It takes time. The US government made it seem easy. It did not plan for the aftermath. Many US troops are still there, and many have died. The government should have told the truth about the war and its goals.

After the war, I wanted George Bush to finish what he started. It is hard to abandon Iraq now. We should try to see the war through. But many American soldiers have died. We must consider if this is worth the risk. The war is about oil, not democracy. No weapons of mass destruction were found in Iraq. North Korea has them but we do not attack them.

I hope the war ends soon and there is peace. But it is unlikely.

I support gay marriage. I have always supported it. I believe it is a personal choice, not a political issue. I think it is not fair to deny people rights because of something they cannot control. It is inhumane to do so.

In my neighborhood, there are two or three openly gay couples, but they are not married. They function like any other family. They walk their dogs like anyone else. I do not think it is the government's place to decide who can and cannot marry. It is a personal, not a public, issue.

I believe that being gay is a biological trait, not something learned. I have read many reports that say this. It is not something people choose. It is not caused by upbringing or environment.

I think marriage should be a private matter. If a man and a woman want to marry, they can do so without anyone knowing. But if two gay people want to marry, it is a big public issue. It should be a private matter, not a public one.

No, I do not think so.

When you put something on the internet, it is public. Everyone can see it. If you say something about violence, people might worry. They might tell others, or even tell the school. The school has to act, because something bad could happen. But some people just say things to be funny. It could also be a serious problem. At my school, someone said something serious. A friend checked their Facebook, and saw something that should not be there. It was a joke, but it seemed serious under the situation. When you put something on the internet, it is not private. If you do not want others to see it, do not put it there. You cannot control what people think or how they react. School officials can look at internet posts if they are brought to their attention. If someone says something dangerous, they must take it seriously. If a teacher makes a fake Facebook account to friend students, it is not good. I would not friend my residents on Facebook. I do not want to see what they are doing. It is not my job to monitor what they do.

This is my opinion. I believe the war has lasted too long.
At first, the purpose was good. We wanted to give democracy to a country without fair political system.
But now, I think we have lost the original purpose. We are fighting just to show we are powerful.
I also think the original motivation was not fair. It might have been because of George Bush's father's past problems with Saddam Hussein.
I think the war started well. It showed that we wanted change. But it has lasted too long.
When we started, we wanted to give democracy. But now, it seems we are just fighting because we are at war.
I believe the war has lasted too long. The country's officials should take care of themselves now.
We have spent too much money on this war. We should spend money on our own problems like poverty and schools.
War is not good for the long term. We have many problems we need to solve at home.

I think that's all.

I want to know more about this. How did it happen?

People on Myspace saw a bad thing and stopped it. They went online and saw it. It was not a mistake. It was intentional. I do not think it is private. If we put things on the internet, many people can see it.

I understand that we must accept this. But, it is hard to decide if this is fair or not. Should we let people look at everyone's profiles? This could be unfair. We do not want to make people feel bad.

It is a hard decision. It depends on the situation. If someone is looking for evidence to stop bad things, they can look at profiles. But, if they are just looking around, we may have a problem.

I do not have a Myspace. But, I do have a Facebook. Some people worry about creepy people seeing their photos or information. This can be dangerous. Some people can find out a lot about us.

I limit what I put on Facebook, but I also want to stay connected with my friends. It is a tricky issue. We must decide carefully. Who can look at our profiles? We do not know.

My roommate told me about a school that banned Myspace. This was strange. I do not think schools can tell students what to do about Myspace. It is a privacy issue. I do not know how they had the right to do this.

The Iraq War was a mistake. I feel bad talking about it. Many people think it was wrong. I was against it from the start. But it's not important now. Most people, including Iraqis, think it was a bad idea.

We invaded Iraq because Saddam Hussein was bad. But we didn't think about the problems that might happen. It's like quicksand. We're stuck now.

The U.S. and Middle Eastern countries are very different. The U.S. wants to bring democracy to Iraq. But Iraqis don't want that. They want us to leave.

The U.S. would like to gradually leave Iraq. But I think we should leave now. Many Iraqis want us to leave. We should ask them. If they say yes, it's not our fault if things go wrong.

I don't see a reason to stay. We should ask Iraqis what they want. We should do what they say. We won't be the good guys in the Middle East. But we can be better than we are now.

I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. It happens in many places, not just for women. Some jobs have long been dominated by men, so it is difficult for women to move up. People have a hard time working under a woman, especially in high positions. Society has taught us this for a long time.

Women often have the qualifications for a job, but the board does not promote them because it is not usual for women to be in business leadership. The same thing happens to men in some fields. Staying at home to raise children is more common for women than men. People often do not respect men who do this.

In the fashion industry, people do not take men seriously if they are into fashion. They think men do not understand fashion well because they are not women. Men in fashion usually have different ways of living.

Depending on the job, there is discrimination in society. It is hard to change because society has a set way of thinking. We have made progress, but change takes time. People are slowly accepting women in higher positions and men at home.

To stop discrimination, we must show the good qualities of people who are usually discriminated against. We should not force change, as people may resist. We are already doing many things to stop discrimination, and it is getting better.

People are also discriminated against because of their background. For example, if someone grows up on a farm, they may face discrimination even if they are intelligent. Other men may not trust them because of their grammar. The same thing happens between genders.

I know they are not allowing it. They changed it to a traffic ticket, instead of being arrested. People worry about this for job interviews. But it's cheaper to give a ticket than to arrest and house them. Denver did this, and they use the money for schools and programs. I think it's good for a liberal city, but not everywhere. I don't think it should be everywhere. I think it's awkward to see people smoking it everywhere. And I don't think it's as bad as alcohol for driving. But it's different for each person. Some people can handle it, and some can't.

I say yes.
Because they do traditional things for a long time.
This is good.
It helps them stay in their beliefs.
But also, they must change.
For example, Catholics must go to church every week.
They are strict about how things are done.
They do not accept people who do not follow the rules.
They also do not accept people of other religions.
My parents were different religions.
My mom was Catholic, my dad was Episcopalian.
The church would not marry them because of my dad's religion.
This is not accepting other religions.
I think it is hypocritical.
Catholic teaching says to love others.
But they do not accept others.
I feel like many rules in the Catholic Church are old.
They continue to follow them.
I think priests should be able to marry.
But I do not think this would stop them from doing bad things.
Because being married is different from molesting children.
I think allowing priests to marry would not stop those things.
I think those things would happen even if priests were married.

I am not sure about this topic. I think it is difficult. Many people are talking about the separation of church and state. They also talk about how to define marriage. I believe this is a tricky subject.

Marriage is a sacrament, like being baptized. People should not get tax breaks or special treatment from the government just because they are married. They should be seen as a civil union, just like two people living together.

If all states agree, they should make it a federal law. But, it is not necessary to change the constitution just to ban gay marriage. The constitution should not be changed for this reason. It is not important enough.

I do not think the constitution should ban gay marriage. It is not a big enough issue.

I grew up in a Christian family. So, I have no clear opinion about homosexuality. My friends are gay, and they are good people. I think it should be legal, but it should be up to each state to decide, not the president. Many states are democratic, and they want to legalize it. If a state chooses to legalize it, I think it should be respected. I don't agree with Bush's ban on it. He should not decide for the whole country. Each state should decide for itself. I don't think it should be a national issue. I think it should be up to each state to decide what to do about it. It's not fair for the president to decide for the whole country. I think some issues should be left up to each state. Plus, Bush will be out of office in two years. If a new president wants to change the law, it will just go back and forth. It's better for each state to decide. I don't think the president should decide for the whole country.

My opinion is that if a student posts something on the internet, it is public and can be seen by school officials. This is true even if it is not on the school's page. School officials have the right to see this, because their job is to keep students safe. If they see something that could cause harm, they should act to prevent it. However, if they go on the internet just to find students doing wrong things, this is an invasion of privacy. But if they find something that makes the school safer, this is not an invasion. In my view, everything on the internet can come back to haunt you. For example, if you say something bad about someone, it might be used against you later. If a student wants to be safe, they should not post anything that could get them in trouble. In my school, we practiced for emergencies like terrorist attacks and school shootings. This was to make the school safer. The school officials were just trying to do the same in this case.

I was all for going to war after nine eleven. I was angry and wanted to cause as much damage as they did to us. But now I think we went in unprepared. We did not think about the long-term effects. We went without a plan. It did not work. I think the people in that country are not thinking about bettering their lives. They are fighting each other. I do not care about what happens over there. I think they will fight each other forever. We did not know what to expect. We were looking for revenge. We should have had a better plan. We were not unified. We did not know what we wanted to do. We should have left. We are not making enough progress. It will collapse when we leave. We are hurting ourselves by staying.

transformed_texts:
I think the Catholic Church needs change.
They lose people because they are not accepting.
They have strict views on things like gay marriage, abortion, and birth control.
These views are old-fashioned.
If they change, they will keep more people.
People disagree with the Catholic Church.
They feel the Church has bad views on these subjects.
The Church is against abortion. If you support it, you feel bad.
The same with gay marriage. If you believe in it, you feel bad.
I think priests can be married.
I don’t know if it would help. Priests are devoted to God. They can have families too.

I am not against gay marriage. Some people are born gay. They cannot choose their sexual orientation. It is not a conscious choice. Therefore, people should not be blamed for being gay. I think it is wrong to say a man and woman can marry, but two people of the same sex cannot. The federal government should not be involved. It is not a legal or moral issue. It is not about the security of our country. The federal government should not interfere with people's lives. Gay people should not be punished for being who they are. That is just how they were born.

Gay marriage should be legal. There is no good reason to say it should not be. Many people believe that gay couples threaten the traditional family. However, this is not true. Gay couples are different from straight couples, but they are still people and deserve the same rights. They should be able to get married, have property, and make legal decisions about healthcare.

Many studies show that gay couples are as successful as straight couples. They have the same relationships and the same factors that make them happy. They are not asking to get married in a church. They just want a legal marriage certificate. If there is no church involvement, there should be no issue. It is not fair to have two different standards for gay and straight couples. It is like having separate but unequal rights.

People worry about adoption and community issues. But gay couples are as good at parenting as straight couples. They have the same skills and can be just as involved in their community. The federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state. It is not ethical to let religious beliefs influence the government. The government should not make a law that goes against the beliefs of a certain group. It is hypocritical to have laws that enforce religious standards on a whole country.

Some people think that gay people are damaged because of their childhood. However, this is not true. The American Psychological Association says that being gay is not caused by trauma or personality defects. People should listen to research and institutions that study these issues, not just their neighbors or culture. The world would be different if people listened to facts and not just popular opinion.

I work at a hospital pharmacy during summer. Some drugs are illegal, but they may have good uses. I think no for public use, yes for medicine. Like oxycotton, Vicodin, Perocets. They are controlled but useful. If we say no to marijuana because it is illegal and bad, that is not fair. We should consider its benefits responsibly. Alcohol can be bad, but so can marijuana if overused. It is not like heroine or cocaine. We should get rid of bad image of marijuana and think about using it responsibly for medicine.

I think church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict now. When I was young, I went to church every Sunday. I wore cute dresses, matching shoes, and a matching purse. Now, they have teenage masses that last only thirty minutes. People wear casual clothes, even on summer weekends. Some families arrive late. Even at morning masses, people wear jeans and khakis. I think this shows how the church has become more casual. About accusations against Catholic priests, I do not think changes like allowing female priests or priests to marry would have prevented these problems. Many married men still become pedophiles, and this is not about their marital status. It is likely genetic. Being born with such an attraction is not something the church could have stopped. If priests knew about these problems and tried to cover them up, they can be shamed. But it is not always the case that they knew. I have no other thoughts about the Catholic Church.

I was okay with starting the war in Iraq. But it felt wrong. Many people were still upset about September 11th. The Bush administration said that Iraq had weapons to attack America. This was not true. They lied to the American people. Colin Powell, who gave a big speech at the UN, now says he was not sure about the evidence. I think this is a big mistake. It is like a crime. The Bush administration did not follow the constitution. They wanted to fight a war. They had a plan to expand energy supply. I think this is not good. I think we should stop the war now. But, if we leave, Iraq might become a civil war. There are many problems with the government. The UN and USA want other countries to help. But, this could cause more problems. The political system is not good. Many groups fight for control. The government is weak.

I feel the Iraq War is not a real war because there was no official declaration by Congress. It feels like a big attempt to get back at Iraq for the 9/11 attacks. I am not interested in this topic because I do not follow the details. However, I think it is wrong to stay in Iraq because it is not beneficial for either side. It is hard to make democracy happen quickly. If we leave, Iraq may be worse off. I feel sorry for President Bush because the war makes him look bad. It is like the Vietnam War, which also was not declared. It is hard to say if the war should continue. Some people know people fighting there, and it is hard to want them to come home. However, staying in Iraq may make the situation worse. It is unclear what will happen in the future.

I am not sure it is right to make it legal or for a state to declare it legal. The constitution says churches and the state should be separate. It clearly says this.
Trying to force rules about it would be against the constitution. It would be like choosing one church's beliefs over others.
Most Catholics and Christians are against it. Only some areas like Boston support it. It is not the government's job to decide what churches can or cannot do.
The constitution has rules about religious tolerance. Making an amendment to change this would be wrong. It would only restrict people, not the government.
I do not think the federal government should be involved. The amendment is just one person's personal belief. It is not about the economy.
I think the amendment could even help society.
I think I have said all I want to say.

The war in Iraq. At first, I did not think the government told the truth about the reasons for the war. Before invading Iraq, they tried to connect the war to the attacks of September 11th. But this was not true. The government used the public's anger to start the war, which began in 2003. I did not support the war, especially for a preemptive strike. I think the war was like the Vietnam War. The government should have learned from past mistakes.

Many American soldiers died. The government removed Iraq's government. I think they were not ready for the chaos and power void that followed. The US tried to implant a democratic government, like in Vietnam. Both wars were long and hard. The government should have been more prepared.

Many people still support the US in Iraq. But it is not easy to create a new government. It takes time. The US government made it seem easy. It did not plan for the aftermath. Many US troops are still there, and many have died. The government should have told the truth about the war and its goals.

After the war, I wanted George Bush to finish what he started. It is hard to abandon Iraq now. We should try to see the war through. But many American soldiers have died. We must consider if this is worth the risk. The war is about oil, not democracy. No weapons of mass destruction were found in Iraq. North Korea has them but we do not attack them.

I hope the war ends soon and there is peace. But it is unlikely.

I support gay marriage. I have always supported it. I believe it is a personal choice, not a political issue. I think it is not fair to deny people rights because of something they cannot control. It is inhumane to do so.

In my neighborhood, there are two or three openly gay couples, but they are not married. They function like any other family. They walk their dogs like anyone else. I do not think it is the government's place to decide who can and cannot marry. It is a personal, not a public, issue.

I believe that being gay is a biological trait, not something learned. I have read many reports that say this. It is not something people choose. It is not caused by upbringing or environment.

I think marriage should be a private matter. If a man and a woman want to marry, they can do so without anyone knowing. But if two gay people want to marry, it is a big public issue. It should be a private matter, not a public one.

No, I do not think so.

When you put something on the internet, it is public. Everyone can see it. If you say something about violence, people might worry. They might tell others, or even tell the school. The school has to act, because something bad could happen. But some people just say things to be funny. It could also be a serious problem. At my school, someone said something serious. A friend checked their Facebook, and saw something that should not be there. It was a joke, but it seemed serious under the situation. When you put something on the internet, it is not private. If you do not want others to see it, do not put it there. You cannot control what people think or how they react. School officials can look at internet posts if they are brought to their attention. If someone says something dangerous, they must take it seriously. If a teacher makes a fake Facebook account to friend students, it is not good. I would not friend my residents on Facebook. I do not want to see what they are doing. It is not my job to monitor what they do.

This is my opinion. I believe the war has lasted too long.
At first, the purpose was good. We wanted to give democracy to a country without fair political system.
But now, I think we have lost the original purpose. We are fighting just to show we are powerful.
I also think the original motivation was not fair. It might have been because of George Bush's father's past problems with Saddam Hussein.
I think the war started well. It showed that we wanted change. But it has lasted too long.
When we started, we wanted to give democracy. But now, it seems we are just fighting because we are at war.
I believe the war has lasted too long. The country's officials should take care of themselves now.
We have spent too much money on this war. We should spend money on our own problems like poverty and schools.
War is not good for the long term. We have many problems we need to solve at home.

I think that's all.

I want to know more about this. How did it happen?

People on Myspace saw a bad thing and stopped it. They went online and saw it. It was not a mistake. It was intentional. I do not think it is private. If we put things on the internet, many people can see it.

I understand that we must accept this. But, it is hard to decide if this is fair or not. Should we let people look at everyone's profiles? This could be unfair. We do not want to make people feel bad.

It is a hard decision. It depends on the situation. If someone is looking for evidence to stop bad things, they can look at profiles. But, if they are just looking around, we may have a problem.

I do not have a Myspace. But, I do have a Facebook. Some people worry about creepy people seeing their photos or information. This can be dangerous. Some people can find out a lot about us.

I limit what I put on Facebook, but I also want to stay connected with my friends. It is a tricky issue. We must decide carefully. Who can look at our profiles? We do not know.

My roommate told me about a school that banned Myspace. This was strange. I do not think schools can tell students what to do about Myspace. It is a privacy issue. I do not know how they had the right to do this.

The Iraq War was a mistake. I feel bad talking about it. Many people think it was wrong. I was against it from the start. But it's not important now. Most people, including Iraqis, think it was a bad idea.

We invaded Iraq because Saddam Hussein was bad. But we didn't think about the problems that might happen. It's like quicksand. We're stuck now.

The U.S. and Middle Eastern countries are very different. The U.S. wants to bring democracy to Iraq. But Iraqis don't want that. They want us to leave.

The U.S. would like to gradually leave Iraq. But I think we should leave now. Many Iraqis want us to leave. We should ask them. If they say yes, it's not our fault if things go wrong.

I don't see a reason to stay. We should ask Iraqis what they want. We should do what they say. We won't be the good guys in the Middle East. But we can be better than we are now.

I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. It happens in many places, not just for women. Some jobs have long been dominated by men, so it is difficult for women to move up. People have a hard time working under a woman, especially in high positions. Society has taught us this for a long time.

Women often have the qualifications for a job, but the board does not promote them because it is not usual for women to be in business leadership. The same thing happens to men in some fields. Staying at home to raise children is more common for women than men. People often do not respect men who do this.

In the fashion industry, people do not take men seriously if they are into fashion. They think men do not understand fashion well because they are not women. Men in fashion usually have different ways of living.

Depending on the job, there is discrimination in society. It is hard to change because society has a set way of thinking. We have made progress, but change takes time. People are slowly accepting women in higher positions and men at home.

To stop discrimination, we must show the good qualities of people who are usually discriminated against. We should not force change, as people may resist. We are already doing many things to stop discrimination, and it is getting better.

People are also discriminated against because of their background. For example, if someone grows up on a farm, they may face discrimination even if they are intelligent. Other men may not trust them because of their grammar. The same thing happens between genders.

I know they are not allowing it. They changed it to a traffic ticket, instead of being arrested. People worry about this for job interviews. But it's cheaper to give a ticket than to arrest and house them. Denver did this, and they use the money for schools and programs. I think it's good for a liberal city, but not everywhere. I don't think it should be everywhere. I think it's awkward to see people smoking it everywhere. And I don't think it's as bad as alcohol for driving. But it's different for each person. Some people can handle it, and some can't.

I say yes.
Because they do traditional things for a long time.
This is good.
It helps them stay in their beliefs.
But also, they must change.
For example, Catholics must go to church every week.
They are strict about how things are done.
They do not accept people who do not follow the rules.
They also do not accept people of other religions.
My parents were different religions.
My mom was Catholic, my dad was Episcopalian.
The church would not marry them because of my dad's religion.
This is not accepting other religions.
I think it is hypocritical.
Catholic teaching says to love others.
But they do not accept others.
I feel like many rules in the Catholic Church are old.
They continue to follow them.
I think priests should be able to marry.
But I do not think this would stop them from doing bad things.
Because being married is different from molesting children.
I think allowing priests to marry would not stop those things.
I think those things would happen even if priests were married.

I am not sure about this topic. I think it is difficult. Many people are talking about the separation of church and state. They also talk about how to define marriage. I believe this is a tricky subject.

Marriage is a sacrament, like being baptized. People should not get tax breaks or special treatment from the government just because they are married. They should be seen as a civil union, just like two people living together.

If all states agree, they should make it a federal law. But, it is not necessary to change the constitution just to ban gay marriage. The constitution should not be changed for this reason. It is not important enough.

I do not think the constitution should ban gay marriage. It is not a big enough issue.

I grew up in a Christian family. So, I have no clear opinion about homosexuality. My friends are gay, and they are good people. I think it should be legal, but it should be up to each state to decide, not the president. Many states are democratic, and they want to legalize it. If a state chooses to legalize it, I think it should be respected. I don't agree with Bush's ban on it. He should not decide for the whole country. Each state should decide for itself. I don't think it should be a national issue. I think it should be up to each state to decide what to do about it. It's not fair for the president to decide for the whole country. I think some issues should be left up to each state. Plus, Bush will be out of office in two years. If a new president wants to change the law, it will just go back and forth. It's better for each state to decide. I don't think the president should decide for the whole country.

My opinion is that if a student posts something on the internet, it is public and can be seen by school officials. This is true even if it is not on the school's page. School officials have the right to see this, because their job is to keep students safe. If they see something that could cause harm, they should act to prevent it. However, if they go on the internet just to find students doing wrong things, this is an invasion of privacy. But if they find something that makes the school safer, this is not an invasion. In my view, everything on the internet can come back to haunt you. For example, if you say something bad about someone, it might be used against you later. If a student wants to be safe, they should not post anything that could get them in trouble. In my school, we practiced for emergencies like terrorist attacks and school shootings. This was to make the school safer. The school officials were just trying to do the same in this case.

I was all for going to war after nine eleven. I was angry and wanted to cause as much damage as they did to us. But now I think we went in unprepared. We did not think about the long-term effects. We went without a plan. It did not work. I think the people in that country are not thinking about bettering their lives. They are fighting each other. I do not care about what happens over there. I think they will fight each other forever. We did not know what to expect. We were looking for revenge. We should have had a better plan. We were not unified. We did not know what we wanted to do. We should have left. We are not making enough progress. It will collapse when we leave. We are hurting ourselves by staying.
